message.content:
cs.DS, cs.DM, cs.NE, cs.SI, cs.AL. 

The paper deals with the problem of designing sparse subgraphs that are fault-tolerant and can be used to construct BFS trees. This involves graph algorithms and data structures (cs.DS), as well as combinatorial optimization (cs.DM) and network optimization (cs.NE). The paper also discusses approximation algorithms (cs.AL) and provides lower bounds, which suggests a theoretical computer science (cs.THE) component. Finally, the problem of fault tolerance is relevant to distributed systems (cs.DC) and security (cs.CR), although these categories are less likely given the focus of the paper.
